Pre-Game Insights: Qatar will be very confident of securing back-to-back wins over Kuwait in March.
Rui Bento's men are unlikely to earn anything from their trip to Doha on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Qatar won back-to-back matches against Afghanistan and India during November, meaning that Thursday's hosts sit top of the Group A standings with maximum points.
Kuwait suffered 2-0 and 3-1 defeats respectively to begin the calendar year on a sour note.
Others: Qatar took part in their first-ever World Cup in back late 2022 as they hosted the tournament, but the Gulf State failed to make it out of the group stage, losing matches to Ecuador, Senegal and Louis van Gaal's Netherlands, scoring just the single goal through Mohammed Muntari.

Kuwait only suffered two defeats during 2023, and one of those arrived in the Gulf Cup against Qatar in the first month of the year, when goals from Amro Surag and Ahmed Alaaeldin sealed a two-goal success for the Maroons.
